intro: Nigella doerfleri, commonly known as the "Queen of the Mountains," is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant produces small, round, peppery seeds that are often used in culinary applications. Its foliage consists of finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Nigella doerfleri thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or alpine soils.
